Topic.Title: why hagel is the anti bush choice

Message.Msg: 1st off, disclosure...I'm a Marine Iraq vet...did the Uncle Saddam thing in '91 as well as the more recent 2003 Takedown. Voted for both Bush's a total of 4 times. BTW, 10 years ago this very week I was activated and given orders to go play in the Sandbox again. Yup, been a decade...dang! I personally rather enjoyed the Bush years...always felt that my President understood where I was coming from. Not so much with this guy in office right now. On Senator Hagel...he has earn my attention to listen to anything he says. I have not formed a complete opinion on the man but I really, really liked his comment the he was the Senator from Nebraska, not Israel. Dang straight! Wish every Senator understood that it's America first. Heck, I wish the sitting President thought that... As for SecDef? Might be rather interesting to have a ground-pounders viewpoint in the hot seat. My initial instinct is to confirm. The whole Israeli viewpoint isn't that big a deal form me...yes, my default is to support them but again...America first.

Message.Msg: QE is ending soon! Jobless rates below 7% in 192 cities WASHINGTON (AP) — Unemployment rates fell below 7% in a majority of U.S. cities in November, suggesting steady job gains are benefiting most parts of the country. Time of demand a raise from your boss. The Labor Department said Tuesday that rates fell in November from October in 215 of the 372 largest metro areas. Rates dropped below 7% in 192 cities. That's the first time since the recession ended that more than half of large cities had rates below that threshold. And 52 had rates below 5%. Major metropolitan areas with low unemployment rates in November included: Oklahoma City, 4.5%; New Orleans, 4.7%; Washington, 5%; and Phoenix, 6.5%. Do a victory lap around Obama's helmet. Salute the chief! Bismarck, N.D. recorded the lowest unemployment rate, at 2.6 percent. The area is benefiting from an oil and gas drilling boom which is being sued EPA. Yuma, Ariz. and El Centro, Calif. reported the highest rates, at 27.5% and 26.6%, respectively. The two cities have high concentrations of illegal alien farm workers from Pelosi's farm.

The Tower of Babel aka Kingdom Tower (Arabic: برج المملكة‎ Burj al Mamlakah‎), previously known as Mile-High Tower (Arabic: برج الميل‎‎), is a supertall skyscraper proposed for construction in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia at a preliminary cost of only US$1.23 billion. It will be the centerpiece and first phase of a US$20 billion proposed development known as Kingdom City that will be located along the Red Sea on the north side of Jeddah. If completed as planned, the tower will reach unprecedented heights, becoming the tallest building in the world, as well as the first structure to reach the one-kilometer mark. The tower was initially planned to be 1.6-kilometer (1 mi) high; however, the geology of the area proved unsuitable for a tower of that height.

Message.Title: In one corner we have every single national and major scientific institution
Message.Msg: Including the National Academy of Science, Yale, Harvard, MIT, Stanford, Princeton, (well everyone) and in the other corner we have Glen Beck- SO WHO IS FLUTIE GOING WITH, Glen who by his own admission dropped out of college because he wasn't bright enough to make it. LOL just to funny. In the scientific field of climate studies – which is informed by many different disciplines – the consensus is demonstrated by the number of scientists who have stopped arguing about what is causing climate change – and that’s nearly all of them. A survey of all peer-reviewed abstracts on the subject 'global climate change' published between 1993 and 2003 shows that not a single paper rejected the consensus position that global warming is man caused. 75% of the papers agreed with the consensus position while 25% made no comment either way, focusing on methods or paleoclimate analysis (Oreskes 2004). Several subsequent studies confirm that “...the debate on the authenticity of global warming and the role played by human activity is largely nonexistent among those who understand the nuances and scientific basis of long-term climate processes”. (Doran 2009). In other words, more than 95% of scientists working in the disciplines contributing to studies of our climate, accept that climate change is almost certainly being caused by human activities. We should also consider official scientific bodies and what they think about climate change. There are no national or major scientific institutions anywhere in the world that dispute the theory of anthropogenic climate change. Not one. NOT ONE, NOT ONE, NOT ONE NOT ONE, LOL

In Maricopa County, Sheriff Joe Arpaio has said he plans to post armed volunteers on school perimeters to protect Phoenix-area students. His plan, announced last month, came after two other Arizona officials released ideas for boosting school security: Attorney General Tom Horne proposed firearms training for one person in each school, and Pinal County Sheriff Paul Babeu proposed training multiple educators per school to carry guns.
